errors.message: Java not found or JAVA_HOME not set
errors.cause: JMeter requires Java 8+ but Java is not configured

solutions.code:
export JAVA_HOME=/usr/lib/jvm/java-11-openjdk
export PATH=$JAVA_HOME/bin:$PATH

# Ubuntu/Debian:
sudo apt install openjdk-11-jdk
# macOS:
brew install openjdk@11

errors.cause: JVM heap size too small for test

solutions.code:
# Edit bin/jmeter or jmeter.bat:
HEAP="-Xms1g -Xmx4g"
# Or via command line:
JVM_ARGS="-Xms2g -Xmx8g" jmeter -n -t test.jmx
jmeter -n -t test.jmx -R server1,server2,server3

# Remove listeners during load test
# Use Simple Data Writer instead of View Results Tree
# Enable CSV output only

errors.cause: Server unreachable or too slow to respond

solutions.code:
<!-- In HTTP Request Defaults or sampler: -->
<stringProp name="HTTPSampler.connect_timeout">30000</stringProp>
<stringProp name="HTTPSampler.response_timeout">60000</stringProp>
curl -v http://target-server:port/

# Add HTTP Request Defaults config element
# Set Connect Timeout and Response Timeout

# jmeter.properties:
https.default.protocol=TLSv1.2
httpclient.ssl.validation.disabled=true
keytool -import -alias server -keystore $JAVA_HOME/lib/security/cacerts -file server.crt

# Add Keystore Configuration element
# Set path to client certificate if mutual TLS

# Use View Results Tree to see actual response
# Adjust pattern to match actual content

# Response Assertion options:
# - Contains (substring match)
# - Matches (regex)
# - Equals (exact match)
# - Substring (faster than contains)

<!-- Use regex to handle variable parts: -->
<stringProp name="Assertion.test_strings">"status":"success"</stringProp>

# Add User Defined Variables:
<elementProp name="myvar" elementType="Argument">
  <stringProp name="Argument.name">myvar</stringProp>
  <stringProp name="Argument.value">value</stringProp>
</elementProp>

# Add JSON Extractor or RegEx Extractor
# after the request that contains the value

# Variables are scoped to thread group
# Use __setProperty() for cross-thread sharing

errors.cause: CSV Data Set Config points to missing file

solutions.code: <stringProp name="filename">/full/path/to/data.csv</stringProp>

# Place CSV in same directory as .jmx file
<stringProp name="filename">data.csv</stringProp>

<stringProp name="filename">${__P(data.dir,.)}/data.csv</stringProp>
# Run: jmeter -Jdata.dir=/path/to/data -n -t test.jmx

errors.cause: System limit on open files reached

solutions.code:
ulimit -n 65535
# Permanent: add to /etc/security/limits.conf:
# * soft nofile 65535
# * hard nofile 65535

# Reduce number of threads in Thread Group
# Use ramp-up period

errors.cause: Server not responding with HTTP or connection closed

solutions.code:
# Reduce load:
# - Decrease number of threads
# - Increase ramp-up time
# - Add think time (timers)

# jmeter.properties:
httpclient4.retrycount=3
httpclient.parameters.file=httpclient.parameters

<!-- In HTTP Request: -->
<boolProp name="HTTPSampler.use_keepalive">true</boolProp>

errors.cause: Required plugin JAR missing from lib/ext

solutions.code:
# Download plugins-manager.jar to lib/ext
# Run JMeter > Options > Plugins Manager
# Install required plugin

# Download plugin JAR
cp plugin.jar $JMETER_HOME/lib/ext/
# Restart JMeter
./bin/PluginsManagerCMD.sh install jpgc-graphs-basic,jpgc-casutg
